author: Staff Reporter
text:
Demanding immediate release of all the 10 pilgrims, who were detained by the Forest Department of Andhra Pradesh on the charge of smuggling red sanders, cadres of the People’s Welfare Front staged an attention-seeking demonstration here on Friday.

R.S. Ramesh, district secretary, MDMK, who led the agitation near Chidambara Nagar bus stop along Palayamkottai Road, said that all the 10 persons who went on a pilgrimage to Tirupati were from Ambalacheri in Sathankulam taluk in Thoothukudi district. They had been lodged in Chittoor prison, he said, and demanded their early release.

The agitating cadres of the Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi, Communist Party of India (Marxist) and the Communist Party of India raised slogans condemning Andhra Pradesh Forest Department officials for “wrongful detention” of innocent people. The aggrieved relatives of the detainees took part in the agitation.
title: Pilgrims’ detention flayed
